1)Die
```{r}
#input: sides vector
#output: boolean
check_sides <- function(sides){
  if(length(sides)==6){
     stop("\nargument 'sides' must be a vector of length 6")
  }
  else{
    TRUE
  }
}

check_prob <- function(prob){
  if(length(prob)!=6){
    stop("\nargument 'sides' must be a vector of length 6")
  }
  if(sum(prob)!=1){
    stop("elements in \nargument 'prob' must add up to 1")
  }
  else{
    TRUE
  }
}

die <- function(sides=seq(1,6),prob=rep(1/6,6)){
  check_sides(sides)
  check_prob(prob)
  list(sides,prob)
  }

fair_die <- die()

#' @export
print.die <- function(x, ...) {
  cat('object "die"\n\n')
  cat(x[1],x[2])
}

```
2)Roll
A list containing vectors "roll", "sides", "prob"
```{r}
#purpose: repeat each value in proportion to its probability in prob

# private function
#' @title die roll function 
#' @description simulates rolling a die a given number of times
#' @param die object (a list of vectors)
#' @param times number of rolls
#' @return vector of rolls
roll <- function(die, times = 1) {
  sample(die[[1]], size = times, replace = TRUE, prob = die[[2]])
}
#roll a fair dice 10 times
roll(fair_die, times = 10)
```
